meanings.definition: Not belonging to the same time period.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifacts were noncontemporary with the modern technology.
meanings.sent2: The old painting was noncontemporary compared to the new sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The noncontemporary clock tried to keep up with the digital world.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense was as noncontemporary as a vinyl record in a streaming age.
meanings.sent5: The noncontemporary architecture stood out among the sleek skyscrapers.

meanings.definition: Not existing or occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The dinosaur fossils are noncontemporary with human civilization.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins are noncontemporary to the bustling city around them.
meanings.sent3: The noncontemporary ghost seemed lost in the modern world.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as noncontemporary as a horse and buggy on a highway.
meanings.sent5: The noncontemporary music echoed through the empty halls.

meanings.sent1: The noncontemporary art style was a stark contrast to the current trends.
meanings.sent2: His noncontemporary views on technology puzzled his younger colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The noncontemporary fashion designer accidentally wore a medieval costume to the event.
meanings.sent4: Her taste in literature was as noncontemporary as a quill pen in a digital age.
meanings.sent5: The noncontemporary language used in the play added a unique charm.
